rev.diff:
Line 3: Line 3:
The '''Canonical contributor agreement''' was a [[Contributor License Agreement]] required by [[Canonical Ltd]] for all contributions to many projects established by Canonical.
The '''Canonical contributor agreement''' was a [[Contributor License Agreement]] required by [[Canonical Ltd]] for all contributions to many projects established by Canonical.
â
In it, the contributor assigned copyright to Canonical and at the same time Canonical gives the contributor "a world-wide, non-exclusive, royalty-free and perpetual right to use, copy, modify, communicate and make available to the public (including without limitation via the Internet) and distribute, in each case in an original or modified form, the Assigned Contributions as (they) wish."<ref name="main">{{cite web | url = http://www.canonical.com/contributors | accessdate = 2010-12-31 | title = Canonical's contributor agreement}}</ref><ref name="Agreement">{{Cite web|url = http://www.canonical.com/system/files/Canonical%20Contributor%20Agreement%2C%20ver%202.5.pdf|title = Contributor Agreement V2.5 |accessdate = 31 December 2010|last = [[Canonical Ltd]]|authorlink = |year = 2010|month = December}}</ref>. A consequence is that Canonical has the right to change the license to a different one and does not exclude that license from being a non-[[open-source license]].<ref name="seigo">{{cite web | url = http://aseigo.blogspot.com/2010/09/copyright-assignments-gone-wild-or-why.html | title = copyright assignments gone wild, or why i can not join Canonical's contributor agreement program | date = 2010-09-15 | author = Aaron J. Seigo, president of [[KDE e.V.]]}}</ref>
+
In it, the contributor assigned copyright to Canonical and at the same time Canonical gives the contributor "a world-wide, non-exclusive, royalty-free and perpetual right to use, copy, modify, communicate and make available to the public (including without limitation via the Internet) and distribute, in each case in an original or modified form, the Assigned Contributions as (they) wish."<ref name="main">{{cite web | url = http://www.canonical.com/contributors | accessdate = 2010-12-31 | title = Canonical's contributor agreement}}</ref><ref name="Agreement">{{Cite web|url = http://www.canonical.com/system/files/Canonical%20Contributor%20Agreement%2C%20ver%202.5.pdf|title = Contributor Agreement V2.5 |accessdate = 31 December 2010|last = [[Canonical Ltd]]|authorlink = |year = 2010|month = December}}</ref>.
As of August 2011, Canonical is requesting contributions be licenced under a Harmony Contribution Licence Agreement, rather than the copyright being assigned to Canonical.<ref>{{cite web
As of August 2011, Canonical is requesting contributions be licenced under a Harmony Contribution Licence Agreement, rather than the copyright being assigned to Canonical.<ref>{{cite web
